reason: The duality bound |<psi, :phi^k:>| <= ||psi||_{C^{k/2+delta}} ||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}} is used with regularity sum (k/2+delta) + (-k/2-delta) = 0, which is exactly the borderline case where the continuous bilinear pairing estimate FAILS. The bilinear estimate |<f,g>| <= C||f||_{C^{s_1}} ||g||_{C^{s_2}} requires s_1 + s_2 > 0 strictly. Fix: use ||psi||_{C^{k/2+2delta}} (which is finite since psi in C^inf) paired with ||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}, giving regularity sum = delta > 0. Then the bound becomes |<psi, :phi^k:>| <= C ||psi||_{C^{k/2+2delta}} ||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}. The conclusion E_mu[|<psi,:phi^k:>|^p] < infinity remains valid with this correction.
